meanings.definition: To reverse one's previous position or opinion.
meanings.sent1: She was backpedalling on her decision to go to the party.
meanings.sent2: He always starts backpedalling when he realizes he was wrong.
meanings.sent3: The politician was backpedalling so much, he ended up where he started.
meanings.sent4: After the argument, she found herself backpedalling on her strong stance.
meanings.sent5: The student was caught backpedalling on his promise to finish his homework on time.

meanings.definition: To retreat or move backwards, especially in a defensive manner.
meanings.sent1: The team was backpedalling to defend their goal.
meanings.sent2: The hiker started backpedalling when he saw the bear approaching.
meanings.sent3: The cat was backpedalling away from the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The company was backpedalling to avoid a financial crisis.
meanings.sent5: The child was backpedalling from the stranger in the park.
